etymologies: mid 16th century (denoting the age of the moon in days at the beginning of the calendar year): from French épacte, via late Latin from Greek epaktai (hēmerai) ‘intercalated (days)’, from epagein ‘bring in’, from epi ‘in addition’ + agein ‘bring’

definitions: the number of days by which the solar year differs from the lunar year.
shortDefinitions: number of days by which solar year exceeds lunar year

definitions: the number of days into the moon's phase cycle at the beginning of the solar (calendar) year.
shortDefinitions: number of days into moon's phase cycle at beginning of solar calendar year
